intro: Cryptantha saxorum, commonly known as the Sierra cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in mountainous regions. It has hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves adapted to arid conditions. Cryptantha saxorum is an herbaceous perennial that blooms in late spring to early summer.
